summary: A fully-voiced quest mod set after a Stormcloak victory in the Civil War.
descriptionHtml:
[b]BLOOD OF THE NORD

THIS MOD REQUIRES [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72938/?]THE SOMEGUY SERIES (SKYRIM)[/url] AND STORMCLOAK VICTORY IN THE CIVIL WAR.[/b]

[b]Description:[/b]
In the wake of Ulfric's victory, the Stormcloaks are still fighting to re-assert control over a devastated, divided Skyrim. Tasked with cementing Stormcloak rule, the Dragonborn must deal with a variety of new challenges, all of which require difficult choices that likely entail unforeseen consequences. The clear lines that defined the civil war are now gone, replaced by shifting, uncertain alliances and murky morality.
 
[i]Blood of the Nord[/i] is a mid-sized quest mod that serves as the opening chapter in a series of plugins that explore the aftermath of Stormcloak victory, including the inevitable war with the Aldmeri Dominion.

[b]Getting Started:[/b]
After you've wrapped up the Civil War questline with the Stormcloaks, enter Castle Dour in Solitude and you'll be prompted to speak with Hrolf Witch-Slayer, who will dispatch you on several introductory quests. Though one of the quests branches off a bit, the general presentation is fairly linear. There are no real sidequests to speak of, though you can expect a handful of scripted encounters based on your choices in the mod.

[b]Feedback:
[/b]Constructive criticism is appreciated. Trolling and/or having an "Entitlemeltdown" in the comments will get you blocked from all my content quicker than you can whistle dixie. If you show your ass, you get a block. Not a question. Not a warning. A block - from all my mods.

In the words of Joe Pesci: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K0G_m7BAbQs&feature=youtu.be&t=10s]Be nice. Don't fuck up in here.[/url]


[b]Difficulty:[/b]
The [i]minimum [/i]recommended level is 30.

[b]Overview/Statistics:[/b]
- Over 500 lines of dialogue
- One new weapon
- Includes several new dungeons and small worldspaces
- The main quest provides roughly 2 hours of gameplay

[b]Compatibility:[/b]
- No known conflicts to date

[b]Credits:[/b]
- The Community: The players and fellow modders at the Nexus sites have been a continuous source of encouragement and support through the months of development.

- You: Yes, you, the player who downloads and evaluates this mod. I depend on you to excoriate any failings and praise the successes. 

The voice actors and actress, who took their time to voice characters, sometimes prompted to voice, re-voice, and then voice again under the direction of my arbitrary, directorial impulses. This mod would be a shadow of its current self without the voice actors and actress, so thank you all.

[b]Other:[/b]
I am known to give out kudos to those who are the first to correctly identify historic, literary, and/or popular fictional references.

My wife tolerates my brash buffoonery with rare grace. She is a living testament to the higher virtues of our species.
author: Someguy2000
